title: Zipkin UI + Elasticsearch: NoSuchMethodError: zipkin.Endpoint$Builder.parseIp
body:
I'm using Zipkin with Spring Boot. Storing events in Elasticsearch works fine, but when I want to display them with the Zipkin UI, I run into the following error:

```
Exception in thread "OkHttp Dispatcher" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: zipkin.Endpoint$Builder.parseIp(Ljava/lang/String;)Z
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$3.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:145)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$3.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:133)
        at com.squareup.moshi.JsonAdapter$2.fromJson(JsonAdapter.java:128)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$4.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:199)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$4.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:164)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$1.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:82)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.JsonAdapters$1.fromJson(JsonAdapters.java:38)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.internal.client.SearchResultConverter.convert(SearchResultConverter.java:57)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.internal.client.SearchResultConverter.convert(SearchResultConverter.java:26)
        at zipkin.storage.elasticsearch.http.internal.client.HttpCall$CallbackAdapter.onResponse(HttpCall.java:106)
        at okhttp3.RealCall$AsyncCall.execute(RealCall.java:135)
        at okhttp3.internal.NamedRunnable.run(NamedRunnable.java:32)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```

My Gradle file looks like this:

```
apply plugin: 'org.springframework.boot'


jar {
	baseName = 'zipkin'
	version = '1.0'
}


dependencies {
	compile(
			'org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter',
			"net.logstash.logback:logstash-logback-encoder:${logbackEncoderVersion}",
			'org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-security',
			'org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-actuator',
			'org.jolokia:jolokia-core',
			"io.zipkin.java:zipkin-server:${zipkinVersion}",
			"io.zipkin.java:zipkin-autoconfigure-storage-elasticsearch-http:${zipkinVersion}",
			"io.zipkin.java:zipkin-autoconfigure-ui:${zipkinVersion}"
	)
}


dependencyManagement {
	imports {
		mavenBom "org.springframework.cloud:spring-cloud-dependencies:${springCloudVersion}"
	}
}

springBoot {
    executable = true
}
```

With the variables:

```
springBootVersion = '1.5.4.RELEASE'
springCloudVersion = 'Dalston.SR1'
logbackEncoderVersion = '4.10'
zipkinVersion = '1.26.0'
```
author: xeraa

comments.body:
Set the version of io.zipkin.java:zipkin

I will raise something to update spring cloud sleuth's deps which might be
setting an earlier version (guess)

title: what's the meaning "88%"  of  this sentence: mysql-ycfsolr_inno 88% .
body:
_9.000ms 9 spans
mysql-ycfsolr_inno **88%**
mysql-ycfsolr_inno x4 3ms ycf-search x5 3ms_

above content show on zipkin  find a trace page

question：
what's the meaning "88%"  of  this sentence: mysql-ycfsolr_inno 88% .   thanks！
author: jahnkey

comments.body:
pretty sure this means that of the services participating in the
trace, mysql-ycfsolr_inno
accounted for 88% of the critical path duration.

to prove it I'd need to look deeper as I've not looked closely at the code
involved
